pros: Versatile (daily trainer, race); Extremely fun ride; Durable; Glove-like fit; Superb grip; Lightweight for a distance shoe; No break-in period needed; Breathable
cons: Loose around ankles; Not for cold weather
RR_verdict: A union of max cushioning and cutting-edge tech, hello PUMA Deviate Nitro! The cat is out of the bag, and this time, it didn't come to play. I found it extremely versatile and EXCELS as a daily trainer, a long-distance recovery shoe, and even a racing flat! Hats off to PUMA, this is truly a promising comeback to the running scene.
awards: Top 6% in road running shoes, Top 7% in long distance running shoes
